meanings.definition: A tree that has been cut back to the trunk to promote growth of a dense head of foliage.
meanings.sent1: The old pollard in the park provided ample shade with its dense foliage.
meanings.sent2: The gardener admired the pollard for its lush green leaves.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels loved to play hide-and-seek around the pollard's thick foliage.
meanings.sent4: The pollard stood tall like a green umbrella in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The children gathered under the pollard, enjoying the coolness of its dense foliage.

meanings.definition: To cut back a tree to promote growth of a dense head of foliage.
meanings.sent1: The arborist decided to pollard the tree to encourage new growth.
meanings.sent2: She carefully pollarded the branches to shape the tree.
meanings.sent3: The tree felt like it was getting a haircut when she pollarded it.
meanings.sent4: Pollarding the tree was like giving it a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: After she pollarded the tree, it looked more vibrant and healthy.
